channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: From Sandpiles to Angel Investments
item.description: The presence of power law returns in angel investing, with the potential for significant contributions from a handful of investments, has implications for portfolio construction, investment strategies, and diversification.

item.title: $3 billion energy giant admits violating pollution limits in Louisiana—just like it did in Mississippi
item.description: Drax Global is already under scrutiny for running afoul of environmental laws in multiple states.

item.title: Book Review: Pause to Think
item.description: This book is direct, delightful, and articulate in suggesting that we take a slow rather than fast approach to getting things thoughtfully done. It touches the minds and hearts of investment professionals.

item.title: U.S. debt interest costs are about to blow past $1 trillion this fiscal year
item.description: The Federal Reserve’s aggressive interest-rate hiking campaign, aimed at quelling inflation, has made debt more expensive to issue.

item.title: Is Illiquidity a Blessing in Disguise for Some Investors?
item.description: Rather than running away from illiquidity, investment professionals, investors, and regulators alike should recognize its potential benefits and consider a more balanced approach.

item.title: Texas AG launches investigation into Houston utility company after power outages left some residents dead in their homes
item.description: Hurricane Beryl knocked out power to nearly 3 million people, and was responsible for at least three dozen deaths.

item.title: Scenario Planning, Foresight, and the Power of Imagination: Navigating an Uncertain Future
item.description: By fostering resilience through the consideration of various outcomes, investment practitioners can better anticipate and manage the complexities and disruptions that characterize today's dynamic environment.

item.title: Stocks usually take 6 months to recover from the type of selloff that just hit markets, BofA says
item.description: Following such pullbacks, 12-month returns on stocks were positive 73% of the time, analysts said.

item.title: Private Equity: In Essence, Plunder?
item.description: To understand what private equity is at its worst is a call to action, personally and professionally.

item.title: Nate Silver charts the course of risk-taking, from Sam Bankman-Fried to Sam Altman
item.description: For Nate Silver poker, Sam Bankman-Fried, and the future of AI are all connected by one thing—risk-taking.
